metadata.title: CVE-2019-11727 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability exists where it possible to force Network Security Services(NSS) to sign CertificateVerify with PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures when those arethe only ones advertised by server in CertificateRequest in TLS 1.3. PKCS#1v1.5 signatures should not be used for TLS 1.3 messages. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11727` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.45-1ubuntu1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.45-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
nss package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.45-1ubuntu1').
